page.title: 04Upper Lutheredge Family Farm
page.content: The family have been farmers since 1944. The owner has no intention of selling the farm.If he had sold the farm a year ago he would have received Â£2000 per acre.If he sold it today he would get Â£1500 per acre.The farm is as it was originally,and since he wishes to continue farming,this does not bother him. The farmer's son manages the farm. He also manages Lower Lutheredge Farm, which has 50 acres of grassland and 300 acres of grain, and Woodcock Farm which has 180 acres of grassland. Two hired hands are also employed. The farmer has 3 tractors and a sprayer.They also have a grain dryer which spins and dries the grain. If he was to buy a new combine harvester for his work next year,it would cost him about Â£50,000.A new tractor would cost him about Â£20,000.
